title: Add Google research area to writing tab and investigate 9-word limit bug

requirements.text: Add a Google research area component to the WritingPage that allows students to search Google directly from the writing interface without leaving the page

quotes: add a google research area in the write your story tab

acceptanceCriteria: A Google research section is visible on the WritingPage
Students can enter search queries and view results or be redirected to Google search
The research area integrates seamlessly with the existing sidebar layout alongside dictionary and thesaurus tools
The interface is age-appropriate for grade 4 students

requirements.text: Investigate and fix the production deployment issue causing the WritingPage textarea to enforce a 9-word limit instead of the intended 2000-word maximum limit

quotes: check why the live version is not letting me write more than 9 word

acceptanceCriteria: The live production version of WritingPage enforces a 2000-word maximum limit
Users can type up to 2000 words without being prevented from entering more text
The word count display shows 'X / 2000' format correctly
The 9-word limit bug is completely resolved in production

constraints: Do not modify backend/main.mo unless absolutely necessary
Preserve existing word count tracking logic in useWordCount hook
Maintain the existing sidebar layout and tool positioning on WritingPage
Keep the story-themed visual style consistent with grade 4 student audience
nonGoals: Implementing a full embedded browser within the application
Adding authentication or API integration with Google services
Modifying the character development, grammar check, or other unrelated pages
Changing the existing dictionary or thesaurus functionality
